----- Original Message -----
From: "Seairth Jacobs" <seairth@...>


> Using something like "receive-since" (I am assuming a timestamp here)
means
> that you have to keep track of the time differences between the client and
> server, since you need to query the server according to its own time, not
> the clients.
There a Last-Modified response header that should work.

>
> I think you would do better to have an "inbox" URI, which only contains
new
> messages.  Once you have received a specific message (indicated via the
> inbox), POST its URI to the URI of the mail resource you want it to be put
> in:
I think this is a good approach for managing the messages, notifying that
they were processed, etc.
But I think the problem S. Alexander is trying to solve has to do with
metadata changing on a listing of items - and getting a list of just the
changed items.

Using a header like If-Modified-Since or If-None-Match doesn't change what
the resource represents - I don't think they can be used to filter out
unmodified items in a list. I think you need to have separate resources to
do the filtering
